section.title: Concept Details
section.para:
Concepts represent a clinical meaning which is assigned a unique identifier, have descriptions that describe the concept, have relationships that relate concepts to eachother, and OWL axioms that provide a logical definition to the concept. The logical definition is used by the Classifier to infer additional relationships between concepts. When a user selects a concept from the Taxonomy view, search results, or the briefcase details about the selected concept are displayed in the Concept Details panel, refer to . This view contains a variety of information about the concept as described below:
Fully Qualified Name (FQN) – human readable unique word or phrase which represents clinical meaning. And FQN
Regular Name (NAM) – is a term of a specified type that describes the concept. A concept can have more than one Regular Name.
Status – defines whether the concept is active or inactive
Module – identifies which module the concept belongs in e.g. a SNOMED CT concept is in SNOMED CT core module

mediaobject.alt: Figure of the Concept Details pane.

section.para: The pane lists the general concept information such as STAMP (define STAMP), its descriptions which include additional names it may be known by in other languages and dialects, and the axiom history which illustrates its taxonomy relationship. Details such as the inferred information or inactive items can be toggled on by selecting "Display options" in the upper right corner, and its refset relationships and history can be found in tabs within the same panel.

inlinemediaobject.alt: Figure of the Display Options modal from the concept viewer. Displays options such as "Show authors, language, modules, filter STAMP date," and more.

section.para: Optionally another concept viewer pane can be opened and will display on the far right side of the window. There are three alternatives to open another concept viewer:

listitem.para: Right-click the concept you wish to review and select "open in new concept viewer".
Highlight the concept you want to see in a new viewer and press "keyboard shortcut tbd, e.g. ctrl+alt+n " to open a new concept viewer.
In the top navigation pane, select "Authoring", then "Launch Third View".
